onboarding.subject: how to integrate AI tools into my product management workflow
onboarding.why: I'm a PM and I keep seeing other PMs ship faster using AI. I feel like I'm falling behind and want to catch up.
onboarding.summary: PM wants to learn AI integration for faster product shipping

profiling.current_level: beginner - has used ChatGPT but no systematic AI tool usage
profiling.vocabulary: non-technical, business-oriented. Knows PM jargon but not AI/ML terminology
skip: basic explanation of what AI is
profiling.depth: practical and applied, not theoretical. Wants to DO things, not understand how models work
profiling.tone: casual, direct, no hand-holding. Treat them like a smart person who just hasn't learned this yet
profiling.background: 3 years as PM at mid-size SaaS company. Comfortable with data and analytics. Uses Notion, Linear, Figma daily
gaps: doesn't know which AI tools exist beyond ChatGPT
no framework for evaluating when AI is useful vs overkill
strengths: high motivation and clear use case
profiling.focus_areas: tool selection, workflow integration, prompt engineering, measuring AI impact on velocity
profiling.learner_context: Works on a product team that's skeptical of AI. Wants to become the internal expert and champion

course_structure.title: The AI-Accelerated PM: Systematic Workflow Integration

phases.title: AI Logic and Strategic Prompting
phases.description: You will be able to construct reliable, context-aware prompts that produce high-quality product artifacts without rework.

lessons.title: Build a Shared Memory: Setting Up Project Context
lessons.description: Moving beyond one-off chats by using tools like Claude Projects and ChatGPT Custom Instructions for persistent product data.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the learner how to use 'System Context' to define their product's target audience, technical constraints, and brand voice. Focus on setting up a 'Source of Truth' in an AI tool that stays consistent across different product cycles.

lessons.title: Prompt Engineering for PM Artifacts
lessons.description: Applying structured prompting techniques to generate PRDs, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
lessons.instructional_seed: Introduce the 'Role-Context-Task-Constraint' framework. Explicitly teach how to prompt for technical user stories and edge-case discovery, ensuring the AI behaves as a senior staff PM partner.

phases.title: Synthesizing Insights and Visualizing Concepts
phases.description: You will be able to automate the analysis of user feedback and generate high-fidelity UI prototypes in seconds.

lessons.title: Automate User Feedback Loops
lessons.description: Using AI and tool integrations to cluster pain points from Slack, Zoom, and customer support tickets.
lessons.instructional_seed: Leverage the learner's data literacy. Show how tools like tl;dv and QuestionPro can identify sentiment trends and cluster qualitative data into actionable roadmap items without manual spreadsheet entry.

lessons.title: Generate UI Wireframes with AI
lessons.description: Transforming text descriptions into visual designs using Figma plugins and rapid prototyping tools.
lessons.instructional_seed: Direct instruction on using WireGen.ai and Fig Flow. Focus on the transition from a written requirement to a visual mockup to speed up stakeholder alignment.

phases.title: Workflow Integration and Tool Selection
phases.description: You will be able to build an automated stack that connects your roadmap directly to engineering tasks.

lessons.title: The PM AI Stack: Evaluation Framework
lessons.description: A systematic way to decide which AI tools to adopt and which to ignore based on your current stack (Notion, Linear, Figma).
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the 'Friction vs. ROI' framework for tool selection. Focus on 'Instant Aha!' factor and native integration capability for Jira/Linear to ensure the learner chooses tools their skeptical team will respect.

lessons.title: Connecting the Dots: Linear, Notion, and Slack Automations
lessons.description: Building automated workflows that keep documentation and tickets in sync using AI-powered triggers.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach 'Workflow Automation' from scratch. Focus on using ChatPRD and Product Monkey to sync Figma screens directly to Linear tickets and Notion documentation, eliminating manual copy-pasting.

phases.title: Measuring Impact and Leading Adoption
phases.description: You will be able to quantify your velocity gains and advocate for AI adoption within a skeptical organization.

lessons.title: Quantifying Velocity: Measuring AI Impact
lessons.description: Using data to track how much faster requirements are written and features are shipped.
lessons.instructional_seed: Focus on business-oriented metrics. Provide a template for tracking 'Time to PRD' and 'Ticket Accuracy' to help the learner build a case for their manager.

lessons.title: Leading Through Skepticism
lessons.description: Strategies for introducing AI tools to a team that is hesitant or skeptical of the technology.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach how to present AI as a 'Drafting Partner' rather than a decision-maker. Frame the usage in terms of risk mitigation and quality control to appeal to senior leadership's concerns.
